values:
So I was just going over the last hundred or so journal entries on this thing and I have come to realize that the shit I cared about then was completely ridiculous! Those old entries are so single minded and one sided. They were very pitiful and and selfish. How did anyone put up with me? Haha
I was going through them, deleting most, until I realized that even though they seem so silly to read now, that was my life. Full of drama, love, hate, anger and angst! What I thought was the complete and utter end of my life I laugh about now. How silly was I?
It basically comes down to what is important today, will not necessarily be important tomorrow.

For those of you who actually still use this thing- and still read it!
Guess the last time I posted anything was Christmas 2007! Yikes!
Hmm- seems my auto spell check doesn't work on this thing- weird!
Anyways, as of August 14th I will be starting my wedding diet. And since diets work better when you write a food journal- I think that perhaps using LJ will help with that.
Now all of you get to read all my suffering and starvation! Hahah jokes on you!

20 days!

I can hardly believe it, but it has been 5 years today I was introduced to my little man.
Happy Birthday Mr. Man, I hope you have a great day!

Way to spend the entire weekend with "the boys"
but hey, it was uber amounts of fun :):)
hehe Adam

What is a Child and Youth Worker

Somewhere in adulthood there occurs an unfortunate stage in life known as Child and Youth Worker--a creature undefined by Psychologists, misunderstood by supervisors, worshipped by children, either admired or hated by parents and unheard by the rest of society.

 A Child and Youth Worker is a rare combination of doctor, lawyer and a native indian chief. They are competent child psychologists, strict disciplinarians, with a twinkle in their eye, minister to all faiths with questions of their own. Child and Youth Workers are idols, with their heads in the clouds and their feet in the mud from yesterdays rain. They are humourists in crisis, a doctor in an emergency, a leader and entertainer.

 While working in a residential treatment residence, a Child and Youth Worker is expected to repair 10 years of damage to Tommy, make Jerry into a man, rehabilitate Lisa, allow Lucy to be an individual and help John adjust to the group. Child and Youth Workers are expected to lead youth in fun and adventure....even with their headaches. To teach indigenous activities...even when they cannot spell the word. To guide youth in social adjustments....when they have just found theirs; and to ensure everyones safety...all while doing logs, drives, telephone calls and councelling another youth.

For all this, a Child and Youth Worker is paid enough to buy gas for their vehicle, food for their bellies, some Tylenol and to live on their nights off. You wonder how they can stand the pace and pressure. You wonder if they really know how much they are worth. And somehow you realize you can never pay them enough, when they leave at the end of their 18 hour shift and say see you in the morning.

Written by Rachele L

"How To Save A Life"

Step one you say we need to talk
He walks you say sit down it's just a talk
He smiles politely back at you
You stare politely right on through
Some sort of window to your right
As he goes left and you stay right
Between the lines of fear and blame
And you begin to wonder why you came

Where did I go wrong, I lost a friend
Somewhere along in the bitterness
And I would have stayed up with you all night
Had I known how to save a life

Let him know that you know best
Cause after all you do know best
Try to slip past his defense
Without granting innocence
Lay down a list of what is wrong
The things you've told him all along
And pray to God he hears you
And pray to God he hears you

Where did I go wrong, I lost a friend
Somewhere along in the bitterness
And I would have stayed up with you all night
Had I known how to save a life

As he begins to raise his voice
You lower yours and grant him one last choice
Drive until you lose the road
Or break with the ones you've followed
He will do one of two things
He will admit to everything
Or he'll say he's just not the same
And you'll begin to wonder why you came

Where did I go wrong, I lost a friend
Somewhere along in the bitterness
And I would have stayed up with you all night
Had I known how to save a life


We don't even know for sure, and yet I feel as though this has driven us further appart. And I know you are scared and I know you dont want this, if there is a this. But. But I wish you would talk to me, see me, let me see you. We need to talk this over and over and over.
There is so much. And I don't want to lose you. I don't want you to no longer trust me. I don't want you to be mad at me or hate me or regret us. Especially regret.
It will all work out, you'll see.

Well i guess it has been like 12billion years since i have updated.. so i guess it is time.
Darren and i are back together, which makes me VERY happy...
he just needed his space, which i can understand.. so we are going to just work on seeing eachother only once a week and not bother to try otherwise.. it seems to be working better, and the communication is better too... hell maybe this one will be in  for the long hall... you never know.

School sucks... i'll leave it at that.

oh and does any one know if a break is ending a realationship or just putting it on hold.... because if it was just on hold do i count the days? because if so, darren and i will be dating for almost 3 months.. if the break counts as a break up than we have been dating only for a few weeks.. i the break counts as just a break then we have only been dating for 2 months... how does it work?? any one?
ugh
why does my life have to be so fucking complicated??
have fun with life
i miss you Darren

So I decided that it was time for Darren and I to have a "talk" little did I know that it would turn out the way that it did...
I basically wanted to talk about the lack of communication in our relationship and the fact that there really isnt an effort to see eachother (from my perspective anyways). I wanted to tell him that I feel that I am the only one wanting things to work out and how it seems that I only want this relationship. Well this entire conversation backfired, instead of reaching out and conversing and working things out and becomming closer to eachother, we are now on a "break" as he feels "things are ready for the next step in our relationship" but he is "not ready."
I don't even know what to think of all this, what have I dont wrong in this relationship? How can you even ask me to not contact you for a few weeks and see if our relationship problems will work out? I really don't understand. I am so confused and hurt and heartbroken. I am not even sure what to think.
Well that is enough of my pathetic sob story....
have a nice day :(

Two-vehicle crash on Highway 41 kills woman

The Whig-Standard
Local news - Wednesday, August 23, 2006 @ 07:00

Ontario Provincial Police in Napanee are investigating a two-vehicle accident on Highway 41 south of Roblin that killed a 39-year-old woman yesterday afternoon.

Police say a southbound Plymouth Neon and a northbound Plymouth van collided head-on at about 12:15 p. m.

The driver of the Neon was killed in the crash and a four-year-old boy in the car was airlifted to Kingston General Hospital with unknown injuries.

Two adult females also in the Neon were taken to Lennox and Addington County General Hospital in Napanee, one with minor injuries and another with more serious injuries that later resulted in her being transported to Kingston.

The 17-year-old driver of the van and a 13-year-old passenger suffered only minor injuries in the crash and were treated at the Napanee hospital.

The stretch of highway was closed until 4:30 p.m. Police say their investigation is continuing.

The identity of the killed woman was not released, pending notification of next of kin.



Driver killed in crash identified

The Whig-Standard
Local news - Thursday, August 24, 2006 @ 07:00

Napanee OPP have identified the driver killed in a two-car crash on County Road 41 Tuesday.

Christine Corkey, 39, of Nepean died when the 1995 Plymouth Neon she was driving collided head-on with a 1996 Plymouth van driven by a 17-year-old girl.


Corkey's four-year-old grandson was air-lifted to Kingston General Hospital with unknown injuries.

Corkey's 18-year-old daughter, who was trapped in the backseat, was taken to Lennox and Addington County General Hospital with severe injuries. She was later transferred to KGH.

A woman in the Neon was also taken to hospital with minor injuries.

The 17-year-old driver and her 13-year-old passenger were treated for minor injuries and released.

Obituary for Christine (nee McIsaac) Corkey

CORKEY, Christine (nee McIsaac) - A bright light in our lives was suddenly removed on Tuesday, August 22, 2006, Mrs. Christine Ellen Corkey (McIsaac). Beloved wife of Tommy Corkey. Loving mother of Amy McIsaac and Jamie Corkey. Grandmother of Damon Bouchard. Dear daughter of Bob and Susan McIsaac, and sister of Teresa Vautrin. Christine loved life and her work with Andrew and Hartell Management. She will be fondly remembered by numerous friends and relatives. Special thanks to Tammy and Paul Turcotte for all their care, love and support. Friends will be received at the Central Chapel of the Gordon F. Tompkins Funeral Homes, 49 Colborne Street (at Clergy Street) on Friday, August 25, 2006 between the hours of 7-9 p.m. Funeral Service to be held on Saturday, August 26, 2006 in Our Chapel at 10 a.m. Interment Cataraqui Cemetery. Contributions to a trust fund established for Jamie's benefit would be greatly appreciated. Please make cheques payable to Jacob MacPherson Menard LLP in trust for Jamie Lee Corkey

You will be sadly missed. Forever and always with love.
Rest In Peace Chris

on their own

I dont care if you would buy me anything I ever wanted or needed. I dont care if you could make Alex and I happy, make us financially stable. I like you for who you are, it's not supposed to be this way. Why does it have to be this way..

Four years ago, on this very day i was holding a brand new alex for the first time.
My god that seems like a million years ago... it kinda makes you wanna cry.
I feel old.

I was in a cab last week and I was told by the cab driver that i "was long over due for a baby."

She is right, I am long over due, I miss the baby smell and cuddles, and even the barf.
Unfortunately having another right now will just be moronic.

So I guess here is the real point of this post
HAPPY 4th BIRTHDAY ALEX!!! 
I hope you have a good one :)

he decided to go over kill on talking, im not sure if he is just chatty or if he was doing it because he was nervous or if he was making up for my lack of taking.
but because his break lights are out he had to get home before dark i had him drop me off at thee kingston ctr. i gave him a hug and told him i had a great time... and then he KISSED me... my insides went all gooshy inside.
i have no idea what i am feeling
how do i fail so at boys :(

 

Hands Down  
 
 Breathe in for luck, breathe in so deep, this air is blessed, you share with me
This night is wild, so calm and dull, these hearts they race from self control
Your legs are smooth, as they graze mine, we're doing fine, we're doing nothing at all

My hopes are so high, that your kiss might kill me.
So won't you kill me, so I die happy?
My heart is yours to fill or burst, to break or bury,
Or wear as jewelery, which ever you prefer.

The words are hushed lets not get busted, just lay entwined here, undiscovered
Safe from the earth and all the stupid questions...
"Hey did you get some?" Man, that is so dumb.
Stay quiet, stay near, stay close they can't hear, so we can get some

Hands down this is the best day I ever remember
I'll always remember the sound of the stereo, the dim of the soft lights
The scent of your hair that you twirled in your fingers
And the time on the clock when we realized it's so late
And this walk that we shared together
The streets were wet, and the gate was locked so I jumped it, and let you in
And you stood at the door with your hands on my waist
And you kissed me like you meant it
And I knew that you meant it, that you meant it, that you meant it

Who would have thought that one person could cause so much emotion and angst. Just once I would love to wake up and have the house cleaned and the dishes done. Just once I would like to have a good day. Go out, have fun maybe even get a boyfriend. But as we all know that is never going to happen. I just want to be happy, just for a little while...
